org.radix.utils.primitives

Class Bytes

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.radix.utils.primitives.Bytes

  • public class Bytes
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for manipulating primitive bytes.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • arrayEquals

        public static boolean arrayEquals(byte[] a1,
                                  int offset1,
                                  int length1,
                                  byte[] a2,
                                  int offset2,
                                  int length2)
        Compare two byte array segments for equality.
        Parameters:
        a1 - The first array to compare
        offset1 - The offset within a1 to begin the comparison
        length1 - The quantity of a1 to compare
        a2 - The second array to compare
        offset2 - The offset within a2 to begin the comparison
        length2 - The quantity of a2 to compare
        Returns:
        true iff length1 == length2 and a1[offset1 + i] == a2[offset2 + i] for i ∈ [0, length1).

      • hashCode

        public static int hashCode(byte[] a,
                           int offset,
                           int length)
        Calculate hash code of a byte array segment.
        Parameters:
        a - The array for which to calculate the hash code.
        offset - The offset within the array to start the calculation.
        length - The number of bytes for which to calculate the hash code.
        Returns:
        The hash code.

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(byte[] bytes)
        Convert a byte array into a String using the RadixConstants.STANDARD_CHARSET character set.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The bytes to convert.
        Returns:
        The string

      • toHexString

        public static java.lang.String toHexString(byte b)
        Convert a byte into a two-digit hex string.

        Note that digits a-f are output as lower case.

        Parameters:
        b - The byte to convert
        Returns:
        The converted string

      • toHexString

        public static java.lang.String toHexString(byte[] bytes)
        Convert an array into a string of hex digits.

        The output string will have length 2*bytes.length. Hex digits a-f are encoded as lower case.

        Parameters:
        bytes - The bytes to convert
        Returns:
        The converted string

      • toHexString

        public static java.lang.String toHexString(byte[] bytes,
                                           int offset,
                                           int length)
        Convert a portion of an array into a string of hex digits.

        The output string will have length 2*length. Hex digits a-f are encoded as lower case.

        Parameters:
        bytes - The bytes to convert
        offset - The offset at which to start converting
        length - The number of bytes to convert
        Returns:
        The converted string

      • fromHexString

        public static byte[] fromHexString(java.lang.String s)
        Convert a string of hexadecimal digits to an array of bytes.

        If the string length is odd, a leading '0' is assumed.

        Parameters:
        s - The string to convert to a byte array.
        Returns:
        The byte array corresponding to the converted string
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any character in s is not a hex digit

      • toBase64String

        public static java.lang.String toBase64String(byte[] bytes)
        Convert an array of bytes into a Base-64 encoded using RFC 4648 rules.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The bytes to encode
        Returns:
        The base-64 encoded string

      • fromBase64String

        public static byte[] fromBase64String(java.lang.String s)
        Convert a base-64 encoded string into an array of bytes using RFC 4648 rules.
        Parameters:
        s - The string to convert
        Returns:
        The decoded bytes

      • trimLeadingZeros

        public static byte[] trimLeadingZeros(byte[] bytes)
        Trims any leading zero bytes from bytes until either no leading zero exists, or only a single zero byte exists.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte a
        Returns:
        bytes with leading zeros removed, if any
